source: Massachusetts Executive Office of Veterans' Services, Boston Public Library, Veterans Legal Services, VA Boston Healthcare

resources.name: Massachusetts Executive Office of Veterans' Services
resources.address: 15 New Chardon Street, Suite 400, One Bowdoin Square, Boston, MA 02114
resources.description: State agency overseeing programs and services for Massachusetts veterans. Compiles many programs and benefits across the Commonwealth for all eligible veterans.

resources.name: Veterans Legal Services
resources.description: Non-profit providing free and comprehensive civil legal aid services to economically disadvantaged military veterans. Services provided at multiple locations including New England Center for Homeless Veterans, Bedford VA Medical Center, Brockton VA Medical Center, and others.

resources.name: City of Boston Department of Veterans' Services
resources.description: Local department providing assistance with benefits and connections to resources for veterans in Boston

resources.name: Disabled American Veterans of Massachusetts
resources.description: Organization that procures benefits for disabled veterans through advocacy and representation

resources.name: Home Base Veteran and Family Care
resources.description: Provides treatment for traumatic brain injury and PTSD for post-9/11 veterans and their families

resources.name: New England Center for Homeless Veterans
resources.description: Provides housing, meals, healthcare, and job training services for homeless veterans

resources.name: Veterans Inc.
resources.description: Provides case management, housing assistance, employment services, and substance abuse support for veterans

resources.name: VA Boston Healthcare System
resources.address: Multiple locations (Jamaica Plain, Brockton, Worcester, plus community clinics)
resources.description: VA medical facility providing comprehensive healthcare, mental health services, homeless veteran care, and benefits counseling

resources.name: Veterans Crisis Line
resources.description: 24/7 free confidential crisis support for veterans and families experiencing mental health crises, PTSD, suicidal thoughts

resources.name: NVF Lifeline for Vets
resources.description: Confidential toll-free hotline staffed by veterans providing support and referrals

resources.name: Chapter 115 Benefits (Massachusetts State Benefits)
resources.phone: Contact your local Veterans Service Officer
resources.address: Every town or district in Massachusetts
resources.description: Massachusetts General Laws Chapter 115 provides financial assistance for qualifying low-income veterans for food, shelter, clothing, housing supplies, and medical care. Every town or district has a Veterans' Service Officer (VSO).

resources.name: Housing Resources for Veterans
resources.description: Veterans may qualify for preference or priority on public housing waitlists with Local Housing Authorities or private subsidized housing developments

resources.name: Hire Heroes USA
resources.description: Employment assistance and job placement services for veterans overcoming employment barriers

resources.name: Wounded Warrior Project
resources.description: Support and services for post-9/11 veterans and service members with physical or mental injuries

additional_resources.veteran_legal_services: https://www.veteranslegalservices.org/ - Free legal aid for veterans
additional_resources.homeless_veteran_hotline: 1-877-424-3838 - National Call Center for Homeless Veterans

notes: This directory includes major state and federal veteran resources in Massachusetts. Every town and city has a Veterans Service Officer available to assist. Many services are free and confidential.
